report.paragraph_text: ## Overview

This report provides a detailed comparative analysis of three contemporary animated films renowned for their exceptional critical and audience reception: "Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse" (2018), "C...
## Detailed Analysis
The analysis is structured into discrete subsections for each film, allowing for a focused examination of their respective data points.
### Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (2018)
"Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse" is notable for its innovative animation style and complex narrative involving multiple realities. The film was met with widespread acclaim upon its release.

The research methodology for this report involved a targeted data retrieval process from established online film databases. The selection of films was governed by quantitative criteria: an IMDb rating...

The analytical process involved:

6-chunk_101_879701532999183224.chunk_text: Summary Reviewers say 'Spider Man: Into the Spider Verse' is acclaimed for its innovative animation and unique visual effects. The exploration of the multiverse and diverse Spider Man characters is praised for originality. Character development, especially Miles Morales and Peter Parker, adds depth.

6-chunk_102_-8274657020063395752.chunk_text: Character development, especially Miles Morales and Peter Parker, adds depth. However, some criticize pacing, plot inconsistencies, and over reliance on visuals. Political and social themes receive mixed feedback. Voice acting and soundtrack are divisive, with some appreciating performances and others finding them lacking.

6-chunk_106_-6890091800248433208.chunk_text: Social commentary Featured reviews matthewssilverhammer https://www.imdb.com/user/ur19752191/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_1_uname) How on God's green Earth did this work so well???

6-chunk_107_-7264923366574319956.chunk_text: How on God's green Earth did this work so well??? https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/reviews/?featured=rw4525715&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_1_hd) The worlds of superhero movies and superhero comics are not as similar as they seem on the surface. Currently, film studios are all about the "extended universe", seeing how many different titles and characters they can shove into one franchise Avengers, X Men, Justice League , making for an easy way to squeeze a few extra bucks out of their lesser known properties.

6-chunk_108_-7821984888438190616.chunk_text: Currently, film studios are all about the "extended universe", seeing how many different titles and characters they can shove into one franchise Avengers, X Men, Justice League , making for an easy way to squeeze a few extra bucks out of their lesser known properties. Comics have this as well, of course. However, they also have something modern movies haven't really tapped into yet: story one offs, a chance for a storyteller to create a unique tale and not be constrained by the implications on or from the larger universe. Spider Verse gets to do just that, while playfully taking on the fun if convoluted absurdity of extended superhero universes.

6-chunk_109_-1912247256920938425.chunk_text: Spider Verse gets to do just that, while playfully taking on the fun if convoluted absurdity of extended superhero universes. Listen, I hear you. "How could we possibly need another Spider Man movie? " Spider Verse understands that question and has a take on it.

6-chunk_110_-8336884428842235479.chunk_text: " Spider Verse understands that question and has a take on it. Yes, Peter Parker is here. In fact, there are two Peter Parkers. There's also a Spider Woman, a Noir Spider Man, an anime Spider Girl/Robot, and a Spider Pig.

6-chunk_111_-2478205470384888315.chunk_text: There's also a Spider Woman, a Noir Spider Man, an anime Spider Girl/Robot, and a Spider Pig. At the center though is Miles Morales, an Afro Hispanic Brooklyn teen who must help these other Spider People get back to their own planes of existence. He fights with his cop dad, he adores his shady uncle, hates being simply the smartest kid in the room, and just wants to do something that matters. Being Spider Man wasn't his idea, but hey, when a radioactive spider gives you powers, what choice do you have?

6-chunk_112_-7788742411984618864.chunk_text: Being Spider Man wasn't his idea, but hey, when a radioactive spider gives you powers, what choice do you have? Look, I don't have any sort of hot take on this movie. It looks great, the humor pops with surprises, the voice casting is beyond perfect. It's simply a stylishly exciting and refreshingly unique take on the superhero genre, and sometimes that's more than enough.

6-chunk_113_-8399031460042779409.chunk_text: It's simply a stylishly exciting and refreshingly unique take on the superhero genre, and sometimes that's more than enough. 10 Hitchcoc https://www.imdb.com/user/ur0278527/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_2_uname) So Much More Than I Expected!

6-chunk_114_-8919592401265839473.chunk_text: So Much More Than I Expected! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/reviews/?featured=rw5267954&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_2_hd) So many have commented, so I will be brief. From an intriguing plot to wonderful characterizations using drop dead animation, this film works.

6-chunk_115_3030384535796160348.chunk_text: From an intriguing plot to wonderful characterizations using drop dead animation, this film works. About ten minutes into it it thought, "This is just a kind of hip hop version of Spiderman. " But the main character is suddenly thrust into a world which he must learn quickly to manage. The canon takes a turn here toward incredible creativity.

6-chunk_123_-9020383880553520316.chunk_text: 10 soulsplosion https://www.imdb.com/user/ur93280127/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_5_uname) the most visually stunning film I've ever seen https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/reviews/?featured=rw4521959&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_5_hd) There's hardly anything I would improve about this film.

6-chunk_124_5851861588450653484.chunk_text: There's hardly anything I would improve about this film. The visuals, concepts, soundtrack, characters, pace, humor and animation are all some of the best I've ever seen in any film; I was worried the hype would ruin it for me, as it always does, but not even the group of kids in the theater who wouldn't stop loudly talking could ruin it for me. It is visually engaging and beautiful in every scene, not to mention with an incredibly unique art style, and is honestly something other animated movies should have to look up to for a long time. The only real issue I can think of is the flashing lights, which really alienates any epileptic audience, but even then it's done so in a beautiful and artful way.

6-chunk_125_26373585269810522.chunk_text: The only real issue I can think of is the flashing lights, which really alienates any epileptic audience, but even then it's done so in a beautiful and artful way. " Themes of family, memory, tradition, and Mexican culture, particularly the Day of the Dead, are highlighted.

8-chunk_98_-3660405819427668508.chunk_text: " Themes of family, memory, tradition, and Mexican culture, particularly the Day of the Dead, are highlighted. The storytelling is noted for its poignancy and excitement, often evoking strong emotions. Some praise the respectful and accurate portrayal of Mexican traditions, while others find the script and plot simplistic. The animation and visual spectacle are consistently lauded.

8-chunk_104_-2977736124460010988.chunk_text: Shocked! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/reviews/?featured=rw3872249&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_1_hd) I knew absolutely nothing about this movie walking in, the only reason I was there was to take my daughter to see it is strictly because my wife said there was a short Frozen film that played along with the movie and my daughter just so happens to be the biggest Frozen fan on the face of the planet. Not only was I surprised by Coco, it might be the most in depth best story line I've ever seen in an animated movie.

8-chunk_105_-3334767287076946791.chunk_text: Not only was I surprised by Coco, it might be the most in depth best story line I've ever seen in an animated movie. It was also educational and shed an entirely new light on the background of the Mexican holiday Dia De Los Muertos. Wonderful movie, can't say enough good things about it! Jared Andrews https://www.imdb.com/user/ur53660798/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_2_uname)

8-chunk_106_262548238761139176.chunk_text: Jared Andrews https://www.imdb.com/user/ur53660798/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_2_uname) A Charming Depiction of a Beautiful Spanish Language Tradition https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/reviews/?featured=rw4029309&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_2_hd) Coco tells the story of young boy named Miguel living in Mexico Coco is his great grandmother . Miguel loves music and must keep his love a secret from his family who has forbidden music of any kind since the days of his great great grandmother.

8-chunk_107_-5223860764874506315.chunk_text: Miguel loves music and must keep his love a secret from his family who has forbidden music of any kind since the days of his great great grandmother. On Día de Muertos, Miguel wants to enter a contest to showcase his musical talent, but his grandmother intervenes, reiterating the family's ban on music. In his hunt for a suitable guitar to play, Miguel finds himself in the land of dead, meeting the spirits of those who have passed on. On his adventure he meets his musical hero, much of his deceased family, and a strange man who asks for his help and quickly becomes a close friend.

8-chunk_108_-3488662674866008427.chunk_text: On his adventure he meets his musical hero, much of his deceased family, and a strange man who asks for his help and quickly becomes a close friend. Along the way, Miguel helps his new friend and his friend helps him understand the true significance of Día de Muertos. Of course, the title character Coco turns out to play a vital role before the movie is over. When the moment arrives, she delivers something powerful, and it's beautiful.

8-chunk_109_-1645880752521621783.chunk_text: When the moment arrives, she delivers something powerful, and it's beautiful. It moved me in a very satisfying way that felt well earned and authentic, rather than manipulative, the way many movie moments of this sort feel. Quick sidebar: when I took Spanish in high school, my teachers would occasionally incorporate culture from Spanish speaking countries usually Mexico into the lessons. In some of these lessons, I learned about Día de Muertos.

8-chunk_110_-6015112987179513086.chunk_text: In some of these lessons, I learned about Día de Muertos. Sort of. I'm not sure if the lessons were lacking or if I just wasn't paying much attention to them. Regardless, I learned more about Día de Muertos from Coco than I did in four years of high school Spanish classes.

8-chunk_111_8726281870825890723.chunk_text: Regardless, I learned more about Día de Muertos from Coco than I did in four years of high school Spanish classes. In high school, my understanding of Día de Muertos was that it was basically a Mexican Halloween. They raised spirits from the dead and played music or something, as I understood it. It seemed silly to me.

8-chunk_112_-5226332261340997260.chunk_text: It seemed silly to me. After watching Coco I realized that the tradition is anything but silly. It's not about the dressing up or the food or the music. It's about family and remembering those that came before us.

8-chunk_113_-8248782487742158695.chunk_text: It's about family and remembering those that came before us. Leave it to Pixar to not only entertain me, but also educate me about a rich and wonderful tradition of another culture. Bravo! 10

8-chunk_114_-1916792502769173410.chunk_text: 10 pramsalim https://www.imdb.com/user/ur77165650/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_3_uname) I cried twice watching this. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/reviews/?featured=rw3872461&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_3_hd)

8-chunk_115_6355603812357563177.chunk_text: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/reviews/?featured=rw3872461&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_3_hd) I have always been a fan of Pixar. They are really good at what they do. These guys set the bar for quality animated movies.

8-chunk_116_681128670166554429.chunk_text: These guys set the bar for quality animated movies. Back then, animated movies were pretty much made for kids only. They were just your usual Sunday morning cartoons. Large eyeballs, goofy voice, exaggerated slapsticks.

8-chunk_117_-7439507270908693807.chunk_text: Large eyeballs, goofy voice, exaggerated slapsticks. Disney had its classics like Bambi, Fox and The Hound, Cinderella, Sleeping Beauty. However, it felt more like fairy tales. Bedtime stories your parents give as they tuck you in.

8-chunk_118_-8018694789373251370.chunk_text: Bedtime stories your parents give as they tuck you in. In this day and age, it wouldn't work that well. Then came Pixar with it's revolutionary debut, Toy Story. Funny, sweet, modern, relatable and plus, completely 3D animated, which marks the first time a feature film was completely 3D animated.

8-chunk_119_-1913825489815887263.chunk_text: Funny, sweet, modern, relatable and plus, completely 3D animated, which marks the first time a feature film was completely 3D animated. And Pixar has been doing just this ever since. Though the movies they released were still a quality entertainment, I haven't felt like this since Toy Story 3. Toy Story 3 made me bawl like a baby.

8-chunk_120_-8473277945938804146.chunk_text: Toy Story 3 made me bawl like a baby. And their newest feature film, Coco, finally made me weep like a baby again. Coco is a heart warming experience, filled with outstanding animation, wonderful music, brilliant writing, and creative models which brings out the best of Mexican culture. The movie took on themes like family, aspirations, and music.

8-chunk_121_973601482164636808.chunk_text: The movie took on themes like family, aspirations, and music. And they merged it marvelously with the Day of the Dead culture in Mexico. I also feel that this movie sends a strong message towards those that had lost their loved ones at some point. The way this movie talks about possessions and the inevitable loss that comes will, I hope, comfort you.

8-chunk_122_4709541177294547277.chunk_text: The way this movie talks about possessions and the inevitable loss that comes will, I hope, comfort you. Coco is a great movie. Definitely the best animated movie this year The Emoji Movie? Yeah, don't think so .

8-chunk_123_-973319782258474356.chunk_text: Yeah, don't think so . Could possibly be a nominee for Best Picture this year. The way it tugs our heartstrings and the emotionally satisfying end will definitely please everyone. And it's definitely up there among Pixar's finest.

8-chunk_124_72229700765122019.chunk_text: And it's definitely up there among Pixar's finest. If Justice League annoys you, just see this movie. I definitely recommend you. Bring your families, kids to grandparents, whoever you like.

8-chunk_125_-2261716897986891334.chunk_text: Bring your families, kids to grandparents, whoever you like. I'm sure they'll like it and I'm sure you'll hug 'em all as soon as the credits roll. 10 Charliedog2015 https://www.imdb.com/user/ur32837247/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_4_uname)

8-chunk_126_-8442883404975047636.chunk_text: Charliedog2015 https://www.imdb.com/user/ur32837247/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_4_uname) Heartbreakingly beautiful. Surpasses Up and Inside Out https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/reviews/?featured=rw4130315&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_4_hd) Coco is about Dias de las Muerte Day of the Dead , family, family crises and musical passion.

8-chunk_127_4990483586470442681.chunk_text: Coco is about Dias de las Muerte Day of the Dead , family, family crises and musical passion. The posters have a boy and an adult skeleton capering through the afterlife. So you can know that upfront, Pixar is going to fully deal with the subject of death that it touched upon I UP and hinted at in the death of childhood innocence in Inside Out. We were subtly forewarned that tissues would be needed.

8-chunk_128_-1480875666321004315.chunk_text: We were subtly forewarned that tissues would be needed. It surpasses the other aforementioned masterpieces by being more relatable, drawing on family restrictions and prohibitions e. g. "there will be no X in this family!

8-chunk_129_-185231675699942191.chunk_text: "there will be no X in this family! " X being "instead whatever has caused pain to a family member in the past". Pick your poison my reader . It surpasses them in making death tolerable.

8-chunk_130_209235489885414078.chunk_text: It surpasses them in making death tolerable. It reminds us that we should be mindful and respectful of all those who went before us. Most of all it taps on the shoulder and whispers that the temporal, the world we live in, in just as important as the next one and we should strive to keep family bonds strong. For when we're at the end of our rope, who else is there to pull us up?

8-chunk_131_-6557698108390684325.chunk_text: For when we're at the end of our rope, who else is there to pull us up? Did I mention bring Kleenex? A full box. Even hard core macho men are driven to quiet sobs and immediate phone calls to mothers and fathers telling them "mama, I miss you.

8-chunk_132_-1950865455595619831.chunk_text: Even hard core macho men are driven to quiet sobs and immediate phone calls to mothers and fathers telling them "mama, I miss you. Beautiful. 10 ilias zournatzis https://www.imdb.com/user/ur56991789/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_5_uname)

8-chunk_133_6804524315816359354.chunk_text: ilias zournatzis https://www.imdb.com/user/ur56991789/?ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_5_uname) Overwhelmed! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/reviews/?featured=rw4067024&ref_=tt_ururv_genai_c_5_hd) I'm a 24 year old student who sometimes tends to overthink about the values of life and how one, including myself, expresses these kinds of thoughts through every form of art that tells a story.

8-chunk_134_6819370560327434785.chunk_text: I'm a 24 year old student who sometimes tends to overthink about the values of life and how one, including myself, expresses these kinds of thoughts through every form of art that tells a story. So as a person that really puts his soul to a movie he watches I have to say that this film is one of the most beautiful things I've ever had the pleasure of witnessing. Coco does a fantastic job of capturing the viewer from the first moment. It cleverly captures the beauty of the "Day of the Dead" tradition, by unfolding one of the most heartwarming stories I've ever seen in a movie, around it.

8-chunk_135_-6639715182870706075.chunk_text: It cleverly captures the beauty of the "Day of the Dead" tradition, by unfolding one of the most heartwarming stories I've ever seen in a movie, around it. The film features a young Musician called Miguel and the pursuit of his dream of being a musician against his family's approval. Throughout the movie while Miguel engages in an adventurous journey through the land of the dead, he is caught between the love he has for music and the importance of family bonds. Quiet a simple and pretty well covered subject.

8-chunk_136_2877027712817137777.chunk_text: Quiet a simple and pretty well covered subject. Somehow, Coco manages to so simply and beatifully capture the essence of what it means to be human. What it means to love and what it means to have passion for the things and the people you love. The story was told in such an elegant way that it didn't make me think about the values it represented, but instead it made me feel them, without me even analysing what I was watching.

8-chunk_137_3225730607419584118.chunk_text: The story was told in such an elegant way that it didn't make me think about the values it represented, but instead it made me feel them, without me even analysing what I was watching. It did it so gradually that at some point near the end I was so overwhelmed by a scene, which definetely goes to my "top 10 best movie scenes" list, that I caught myself crying. Not tearing up like I usually do when a scene touches me. Actually crying.

8-chunk_138_7503159312639986139.chunk_text: Actually crying. I could go on and on about Coco, but I'll leave with saying that this is a fantastic movie and I honestly feel grateful that I had the chance to watch it. A must see!!! More like this

8-chunk_153_7925895633420762641.chunk_text: Edit https://contribute.imdb.com/updates?edit=tt2380307/fun-facts&tt_dyk) Trivia https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/trivia/?ref_=tt_dyk_trv) During one of the visits to an Oaxacan family in Mexico for inspiration, director Lee Unkrich https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0881279/?ref_=dyk_trv)

8-chunk_154_3515054421505651959.chunk_text: Lee Unkrich https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0881279/?ref_=dyk_trv) paid particular attention to a traditional ofrenda that holds pictures of the dead and is also used to offer food during the Día de Muertos. He noticed the family Basset hound had to be repeatedly chased away from the ofrenda because it tried to eat the food. He found this so amusing that he included a scene in the movie where Miguel is horrified to find Dante eating food from the ofrenda.

8-chunk_155_448004875175340427.chunk_text: He found this so amusing that he included a scene in the movie where Miguel is horrified to find Dante eating food from the ofrenda. No Text https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/trivia/?ref_=tt_dyk_trv) Goofs https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/goofs/?tab=gf&ref_=tt_dyk_gf) The dead are obviously stuck at the age that they died.

8-chunk_156_4697288076915359240.chunk_text: The dead are obviously stuck at the age that they died. Imelda and Hector have spent several years in the afterlife at the same time, and Imelda has never realized that Hector is the same age as he was when he left her, clearly indicating the reason he never came back. She still wouldn't have known that he intended to come back and could simply think that he died shortly after deserting his family. 10-chunk_41_1129000549184752180.chunk_text: How on God's green Earth did this work so well??? https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw4525715/?ref_=tturv_1) The worlds of superhero movies and superhero comics are not as similar as they seem on the surface. Currently, film studios are all about the "extended universe", seeing how many different titles and characters they can shove into one franchise Avengers, X Men, Justice League , making for an easy way to squeeze a few extra bucks out of their lesser known properties.

10-chunk_42_-7821984888438190616.chunk_text: Currently, film studios are all about the "extended universe", seeing how many different titles and characters they can shove into one franchise Avengers, X Men, Justice League , making for an easy way to squeeze a few extra bucks out of their lesser known properties. Comics have this as well, of course. However, they also have something modern movies haven't really tapped into yet: story one offs, a chance for a storyteller to create a unique tale and not be constrained by the implications on or from the larger universe. Spider Verse gets to do just that, while playfully taking on the fun if convoluted absurdity of extended superhero universes.

10-chunk_43_-1912247256920938425.chunk_text: Spider Verse gets to do just that, while playfully taking on the fun if convoluted absurdity of extended superhero universes. Listen, I hear you. "How could we possibly need another Spider Man movie? " Spider Verse understands that question and has a take on it.

10-chunk_44_-8336884428842235479.chunk_text: " Spider Verse understands that question and has a take on it. Yes, Peter Parker is here. In fact, there are two Peter Parkers. There's also a Spider Woman, a Noir Spider Man, an anime Spider Girl/Robot, and a Spider Pig.

10-chunk_45_-2478205470384888315.chunk_text: There's also a Spider Woman, a Noir Spider Man, an anime Spider Girl/Robot, and a Spider Pig. At the center though is Miles Morales, an Afro Hispanic Brooklyn teen who must help these other Spider People get back to their own planes of existence. He fights with his cop dad, he adores his shady uncle, hates being simply the smartest kid in the room, and just wants to do something that matters. Being Spider Man wasn't his idea, but hey, when a radioactive spider gives you powers, what choice do you have?

10-chunk_46_-7788742411984618864.chunk_text: Being Spider Man wasn't his idea, but hey, when a radioactive spider gives you powers, what choice do you have? Look, I don't have any sort of hot take on this movie. It looks great, the humor pops with surprises, the voice casting is beyond perfect. It's simply a stylishly exciting and refreshingly unique take on the superhero genre, and sometimes that's more than enough.

10-chunk_47_-8399031460042779409.chunk_text: It's simply a stylishly exciting and refreshingly unique take on the superhero genre, and sometimes that's more than enough. Helpful 266 88

10-chunk_61_-1112738740191461300.chunk_text: 10 10 the most visually stunning film I've ever seen https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw4521959/?ref_=tturv_5) There's hardly anything I would improve about this film.

10-chunk_62_5851861588450653484.chunk_text: There's hardly anything I would improve about this film. The visuals, concepts, soundtrack, characters, pace, humor and animation are all some of the best I've ever seen in any film; I was worried the hype would ruin it for me, as it always does, but not even the group of kids in the theater who wouldn't stop loudly talking could ruin it for me. It is visually engaging and beautiful in every scene, not to mention with an incredibly unique art style, and is honestly something other animated movies should have to look up to for a long time. The only real issue I can think of is the flashing lights, which really alienates any epileptic audience, but even then it's done so in a beautiful and artful way.

10-chunk_70_1128533633471544177.chunk_text: The better the art, the harder it is to find the right words to describe it. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw4524173/?ref_=tturv_7) Updated review 4 9 19 I've now watched this movie 10 times since getting it on digital and then Blu ray and can safely say this is a rare, near perfect movie.

10-chunk_71_477255697957266306.chunk_text: I've now watched this movie 10 times since getting it on digital and then Blu ray and can safely say this is a rare, near perfect movie. This is of course my opinion and I understand why this movie isn't for everyone. Let's break down a few of the reasons why for each of these points. If we had a list of everything that can be done to make a near perfect movie, this movie checks every box.

10-chunk_72_1058550205920629575.chunk_text: If we had a list of everything that can be done to make a near perfect movie, this movie checks every box. The visuals have been talked about endlessly. It won an Oscar for them. We know they're great.

10-chunk_73_-7313741008132433568.chunk_text: We know they're great. The story is great, giving us a new Spider Man with his own skills and personality that he brings to the table. The script is tight and the production is executed with laser precision. The voice acting is nothing short of top notch.

10-chunk_74_9062635936544886200.chunk_text: The voice acting is nothing short of top notch. This is easily the second best thing about this movie right behind the glorious visuals. Shamiek Moore has quickly grown on me over the ten times I've watched this movie. His range is as good as any veteran actor and he injects so much life into Miles Morales.

10-chunk_75_1490417340958512885.chunk_text: His range is as good as any veteran actor and he injects so much life into Miles Morales. He IS Miles Morales. Chris Pine did not phone in the short amount of lines he had whatsoever. Just superb casting because he and Jake Johnson sound pretty similar.

10-chunk_76_-3519206959102103014.chunk_text: Just superb casting because he and Jake Johnson sound pretty similar. And oh boy, Jake Johnson. I never understood why JJ had gotten so wildly popular over the last several years. With this movie I finally understand.

10-chunk_77_84428222289278730.chunk_text: With this movie I finally understand. I get it. It clicked. From the moment he pops up in this movie around the 20 minute mark till the end, Jake turns in one of the voice acting performances perhaps of all time.

10-chunk_78_7184052056710526307.chunk_text: From the moment he pops up in this movie around the 20 minute mark till the end, Jake turns in one of the voice acting performances perhaps of all time. He succeeds in bringing a past his prime Peter Parker to life and runs the gamut of dramatic, sincere, intense, but above all FUNNY. Every single comedic line never fails to make me laugh out loud. Many of the gags pop into my head while I'm working or doing something else and I'll chuckle and repeat the line to myself.

10-chunk_79_5257163274848949767.chunk_text: Many of the gags pop into my head while I'm working or doing something else and I'll chuckle and repeat the line to myself. I've always enjoyed Hailee Steinfeld and she shines in this movie along with all the supporting cast. The greatest thing about this movie also happens to be its weakness. For me, the visuals are second to none.

10-chunk_80_-8268760469046151118.chunk_text: For me, the visuals are second to none. Another review title summed it up perfectly. "The most visually stunning movie I've ever seen". Absolutely agree.

10-chunk_81_3085838474653206299.chunk_text: Absolutely agree. And while it takes a little time usually 10 15 minutes for your eyes to adjust to the frame rate, some people apparently can not adjust to this. I can imagine how poor that viewing experience would be, too bad really. Another thing is since they didn't use actual motion blur, but instead chose to animate blur like artifacts and tricks to make it seem like blur, or having images doubled and overlapped for a ghosting effect, it confuses some people into thinking they're seeing the 2 images of the 3D version without the glasses.

10-chunk_82_5468478543088266804.chunk_text: Another thing is since they didn't use actual motion blur, but instead chose to animate blur like artifacts and tricks to make it seem like blur, or having images doubled and overlapped for a ghosting effect, it confuses some people into thinking they're seeing the 2 images of the 3D version without the glasses. And lastly, the sheer intensity of some of the rapid action sequences combined with visual aesthetic pushed just beyond the breaking point and then dialed ever so slightly back by the direction team, it's just simply too much for some people. I get that. As far as continuity/plot holes and things of that nature, I think the movie could actually stand to be about 15 20 minutes longer.

10-chunk_83_6352507869957492264.chunk_text: As far as continuity/plot holes and things of that nature, I think the movie could actually stand to be about 15 20 minutes longer. There really aren't many issues though so maybe this is just me being greedy for more visuals. Original review: Sure, we can dissect and critique and praise using any number of words we choose, but in the end to actually appreciate truly great art, it simply must be experienced in the medium in which it was created. For this movie, it was lovingly crafted in 3D, and so in my opinion can only be fully realized by the viewer in 3D.

10-chunk_84_-5913924112215045038.chunk_text: For this movie, it was lovingly crafted in 3D, and so in my opinion can only be fully realized by the viewer in 3D. What is a comic book movie, and what makes it great? From the original Superman where we first saw a comic book hero fly, to Burton's dark and stylized Batman, to the graphic novel style Sin City, live action ensemble X MEN, Spider Man, Iron Man, The Dark Knight, the entire MCU.... all of these are comic book movies, and depending on your personal definition probably range from good to great.

10-chunk_85_1343089917542480048.chunk_text: all of these are comic book movies, and depending on your personal definition probably range from good to great. And they're all live action with varying degrees of special effects, and some with animation. If you had to pick ones that 'feel the most like a comic book', you'd probably pick Sin City for the overall look, and the phase 3 MCU films for a combination of visuals and capturing the tone and spirit of the comic book story arcs. But they aren't literally animated comics.

10-chunk_86_-3706365093751790299.chunk_text: But they aren't literally animated comics. The closest to that would probably be the animated movies, right? Like Mask of the Phantasm or any number of the Marvel animated movies. But again those are really 'just cartoons', and I don't mean that in a bad way.

10-chunk_87_5447261257357202110.chunk_text: But again those are really 'just cartoons', and I don't mean that in a bad way. They're simply cartoon versions of comic books. Spider Man: Into The Spider Verse is quite literally an animated comic book, and yet it is so much more at the same time. It's an explosion of comic book ink and paper, a dizzying palette of superbly rich colors, a jaw dropping display of digital artistry melded with living, breathing characters we care about, a story that is perfectly derived from the very medium in which it is being created and yet not

10-chunk_88_-7260299291012255530.chunk_text: It's an explosion of comic book ink and paper, a dizzying palette of superbly rich colors, a jaw dropping display of digital artistry melded with living, breathing characters we care about, a story that is perfectly derived from the very medium in which it is being created and yet not This movie is breathtakingly good in every aspect. Like I'm questioning my sanity is it really as good as I think it is!?!? Yes.

10-chunk_89_8632520952885867633.chunk_text: Yes. Yes yes yes. Remember the old Sega game Comix Zone? And how it was like "oh wow!

10-chunk_90_8359348400333141305.chunk_text: And how it was like "oh wow! It's a comic book come to life! "? This is like that, with modern technology, cranked up a thousand times.

10-chunk_91_-1431402504228995822.chunk_text: This is like that, with modern technology, cranked up a thousand times. But here's the most important part it was all done in the right way, by the right people, at the right time . It feels like this project was greenlit and handed to the very people who created comic books themselves with a "here ya go, you have full creative control. Oh and by the way you have an unlimited budget!

10-chunk_92_-6467602480476209727.chunk_text: Oh and by the way you have an unlimited budget! And resources! Have as much fun making a great movie as you possibly can! My first job was working in a movie theater.

10-chunk_93_-1308686356148533347.chunk_text: My first job was working in a movie theater. I took full advantage of being able to see free movies. I've built a decent surround sound system with all the creature comforts and have a growing library of movies. 10-chunk_94_8376721904290209335.chunk_text: From the re release of the original Star Wars trilogy, to each of the prequels and to the ongoing trilogy today, T 2, Titanic, the original X Men, Avatar, The Dark Knight, Avengers, Avengers: Infinity War and so many more... I've gone to many, many big movie theater events for the experience. And I can safely say hands down that Spider Man: Into the Spider Verse in 3D is the best moviegoing experience I have ever had. It's that great.

10-chunk_122_-8028400585024529393.chunk_text: Good fun, but overrated. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw10288098/?ref_=tturv_12) Spider Man: Into the Spider Verse is often hailed as a game changer, but is it really all that? Sure, the animation is incredible it's unlike anything we've seen before, mixing comic book style with 3D in a way that feels fresh.

10-chunk_123_9220381830072252035.chunk_text: Sure, the animation is incredible it's unlike anything we've seen before, mixing comic book style with 3D in a way that feels fresh. But let's be honest, the hype surrounding it might be a bit much. The story itself? It's decent but a bit all over the place.

10-chunk_124_4508606314316965612.chunk_text: It's decent but a bit all over the place. The whole idea of multiple Spider People from different dimensions is cool at first, but it starts to feel crowded and a bit confusing. Instead of focusing on one solid story, it throws too much at you and doesn't quite know where to go with it all. Miles Morales, the film's lead, is a great character, but we don't really get to dive into his development as much as we should.

10-chunk_125_-5189894254947702133.chunk_text: Miles Morales, the film's lead, is a great character, but we don't really get to dive into his development as much as we should. The film's busy juggling other characters like Peter B. Parker and Spider Gwen, but they don't really offer anything deep or groundbreaking either. They're fun, but we're left wanting more.

10-chunk_126_3576659989583531753.chunk_text: They're fun, but we're left wanting more. And don't get me started on the pacing. The first half is solid, but by the time all the Spider heroes show up, it starts to feel a bit rushed and chaotic. You almost lose track of why you're even invested in the story by the end.

10-chunk_127_-9030945184597148693.chunk_text: You almost lose track of why you're even invested in the story by the end. It's not that Spider Verse is a bad film far from it. It's fun, colourful, and has moments of brilliance. But is it really the masterpiece some claim?

10-chunk_128_8434299121110983725.chunk_text: But is it really the masterpiece some claim? Maybe not. It's definitely not as deep or well rounded as some would have you believe. If you're into flashy visuals and light hearted action, it's a good watch, but don't be fooled into thinking it's a revolutionary superhero flick.

10-chunk_131_3185599722355849618.chunk_text: It's just okay. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw4696472/?ref_=tturv_13) The visuals, while extremely ADHD are beautiful and help mask the usual uncanny valley physics that plague CGI heavy movies. 10-chunk_132_-7414530611523186334.chunk_text: That said, what is actually happening in some scenes is pretty vague, generally it's too busy. The story telling is competent, when the writing isn't tripping over itself with overly concious lines, or progressive character tropes. At least unlike most such movies, the messaging doesn't entirely overtake the plot, and there is actual character development. And even with those progressive tropes, there is some messaging around courage, and tenacity, typical of heroic movies that are often absent in the more wish forfillment progressive typical story telling.

10-chunk_133_-3092818318688743433.chunk_text: And even with those progressive tropes, there is some messaging around courage, and tenacity, typical of heroic movies that are often absent in the more wish forfillment progressive typical story telling. Still, whilst it is somewhat hamfisted message fiction, they manage to wrap it into a plot that makes the film servicable and tucks the messaging into places where a less observant eye might miss it. In general, it's safe to say this is pitched at kids.

10-chunk_142_5947481903374879637.chunk_text: Permalink https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw5267954/?ref_=tturv_perm_14) 10 10 Into The Spider verse reminds us why we love Spiderman so much, and does so in an original and humane way.

10-chunk_143_-22520783354469767.chunk_text: Into The Spider verse reminds us why we love Spiderman so much, and does so in an original and humane way. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw4525376/?ref_=tturv_15) Heads up: I'm only going to be talking about Peter Parker in this review. I'll make a separate one for the film laterm I just feel like he deserves his own review.

10-chunk_144_-4601105804445522053.chunk_text: I'll make a separate one for the film laterm I just feel like he deserves his own review. That's how great Peter is in this film. Into The Spider verse reminds us why we love Spiderman so much, and does so in an original and humane way. I used to love Spiderman as a kid.

10-chunk_145_1651870562947781152.chunk_text: I used to love Spiderman as a kid. I got obssessed with the cartoons he starred in as well as the original movie trilogy, one that actually helped me get interested in the character and marvel as a whole. But my love for this character, as most things, dissolved and it never got around to build itself up again, even after constant remakes and wonderful performances. I never felt that spark again, that love I felt for this charming dude was gone, dead.

10-chunk_146_2123723240799823440.chunk_text: I never felt that spark again, that love I felt for this charming dude was gone, dead. Then Into The Spider verse came, and my whole world turned upside down. I felt a fire inside my stomach. There it was, that long forgotten love for Peter Parker, one that I thought I would never experience again, expanding continuously as the movie progressed, hitting me in all the right places.

10-chunk_147_5309548396188264504.chunk_text: There it was, that long forgotten love for Peter Parker, one that I thought I would never experience again, expanding continuously as the movie progressed, hitting me in all the right places. I'd even dare to say that this movie made me understand the reason as to why spider man is universally loved: He's an everyday guy with super powers, that's it. He's flawed but pure at heart.

10-chunk_148_7988936905597371936.chunk_text: He's flawed but pure at heart. He's relatable. He belongs to the people. He's one of us.

10-chunk_149_-4211024171900648930.chunk_text: He's one of us. This movie's fresh take on Peter Parker is exactly what we needed to fully grasp that, how compelling this character can be without using any of his super powers. This version of Peter Parker is fat, subtly depressed, and tired, yet he's the most charming and lovable version of this character yet. It's something we haven't seen in quite a while, the genuine humanity that makes Peter Parker such a charismatic character, and one can only be thankful for it.

10-chunk_150_8242212830652091436.chunk_text: It's something we haven't seen in quite a while, the genuine humanity that makes Peter Parker such a charismatic character, and one can only be thankful for it. Spider man is cool again, but in a totally different, and perhaps even better, way. Just your everyday dude taking a leap of faith, giving the audience who relates to his struggles courage to do the same. This is what Spiderman can be and what he should be.

10-chunk_151_5597724448227223187.chunk_text: This is what Spiderman can be and what he should be. A character that's ours, a character that teaches you that anyone can be a hero, that's the real Spiderman. This is the true Homecoming. Spiderman is freaking back!

10-chunk_152_-5251223289469817147.chunk_text: Spiderman is freaking back! Welcome home! Helpful 280

10-chunk_167_3078093704297836387.chunk_text: Dec 13, 2018 Permalink https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw4509260/?ref_=tturv_perm_18) Creative, funny, engaging, and exciting https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4633694/review/rw5136932/?ref_=tturv_19) There was a lot of hype about this film, which surprised me because when I first glanced at the trailer I just dismissed what I saw as a direct to TV film.

10-chunk_168_7022807375670764249.chunk_text: There was a lot of hype about this film, which surprised me because when I first glanced at the trailer I just dismissed what I saw as a direct to TV film. The hype gave me pause but at the same time made me wait so that it had time to settle into reality. Coming to it outside of the hype and awards, I was open to what to expect, and was pleasantly surprised. What pleased me was how creative it was in several areas of production.

10-chunk_169_6988555589619038373.chunk_text: What pleased me was how creative it was in several areas of production. In terms of narrative it took the risk to be silly with its alternative Spider Men, but was able to balance that with an engaging and reasonably serious core narrative. It managed to be funny, fun, engaging, and enjoyable all the way through. Animation wise it mixed many styles and approaches very well.

10-chunk_170_-8920963249271778032.chunk_text: Animation wise it mixed many styles and approaches very well. Even when it felt OTT with the visuals, it still somehow worked and I didn't feel beaten down or tired as sometimes can happen with visual overload. The overall design of the film added to this, with good use of music, shot framing, and animation to make it feel very cool and fluid throughout. Production wise, it felt like it "got" the sense of humour of the script and made that work more than it otherwise would have done.

10-chunk_171_5102725592680649727.chunk_text: Production wise, it felt like it "got" the sense of humour of the script and made that work more than it otherwise would have done. Voice performances also seem to get this, and everyone plays their characters well. Overall, it is creative, funny, engaging, and exciting for those that get into it and accept it on its own terms. Helpful

11-chunk_41_-5664913218254778689.chunk_text: Pixar has created a masterpiece of cinema https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4152853/?ref_=tturv_1) I'm no critic, but Coco is close to movie perfection. It definitely deserved the Oscar for Best Animated Feature, no doubt, and is by far the best animated movie ever created. The visuals are stunning, the characters are fantastic, the twist is somewhat predictable but still great, and the story is so touching.

11-chunk_42_-8732661612517669578.chunk_text: The visuals are stunning, the characters are fantastic, the twist is somewhat predictable but still great, and the story is so touching. This is the best film I have ever seen, over Shawshank, over The Godfather, over The Matrix; this film is a godlike creation from the very, very best of cinema. Do not be fooled by the haters who say it is a poor portrayal of a tradition; the tradition is likely far more beautiful in Coco than in real life. Fantastic, I am blown away.

11-chunk_43_2726382147117283117.chunk_text: Fantastic, I am blown away. Helpful 246 54

11-chunk_45_-5917082205591578031.chunk_text: Permalink https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4152853/?ref_=tturv_perm_1) 10 A Charming Depiction of a Beautiful Spanish Language Tradition https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4029309/?ref_=tturv_2) Coco tells the story of young boy named Miguel living in Mexico Coco is his great grandmother .

11-chunk_46_7025279685189306226.chunk_text: Coco tells the story of young boy named Miguel living in Mexico Coco is his great grandmother . Miguel loves music and must keep his love a secret from his family who has forbidden music of any kind since the days of his great great grandmother. On Día de Muertos, Miguel wants to enter a contest to showcase his musical talent, but his grandmother intervenes, reiterating the family's ban on music. In his hunt for a suitable guitar to play, Miguel finds himself in the land of dead, meeting the spirits of those who have passed on.

11-chunk_47_-2573678525304222384.chunk_text: In his hunt for a suitable guitar to play, Miguel finds himself in the land of dead, meeting the spirits of those who have passed on. On his adventure he meets his musical hero, much of his deceased family, and a strange man who asks for his help and quickly becomes a close friend. Along the way, Miguel helps his new friend and his friend helps him understand the true significance of Día de Muertos. Of course, the title character Coco turns out to play a vital role before the movie is over.

11-chunk_48_8412261127362685929.chunk_text: Of course, the title character Coco turns out to play a vital role before the movie is over. When the moment arrives, she delivers something powerful, and it's beautiful. It moved me in a very satisfying way that felt well earned and authentic, rather than manipulative, the way many movie moments of this sort feel. Quick sidebar: when I took Spanish in high school, my teachers would occasionally incorporate culture from Spanish speaking countries usually Mexico into the lessons.

11-chunk_49_-6205962709258462049.chunk_text: Quick sidebar: when I took Spanish in high school, my teachers would occasionally incorporate culture from Spanish speaking countries usually Mexico into the lessons. In some of these lessons, I learned about Día de Muertos. Sort of. I'm not sure if the lessons were lacking or if I just wasn't paying much attention to them.

11-chunk_50_3422443856888663259.chunk_text: I'm not sure if the lessons were lacking or if I just wasn't paying much attention to them. Regardless, I learned more about Día de Muertos from Coco than I did in four years of high school Spanish classes. In high school, my understanding of Día de Muertos was that it was basically a Mexican Halloween. They raised spirits from the dead and played music or something, as I understood it.

11-chunk_51_155691319799372112.chunk_text: They raised spirits from the dead and played music or something, as I understood it. It seemed silly to me. After watching Coco I realized that the tradition is anything but silly. It's not about the dressing up or the food or the music.

11-chunk_52_-7617367253750349356.chunk_text: It's not about the dressing up or the food or the music. It's about family and remembering those that came before us. Leave it to Pixar to not only entertain me, but also educate me about a rich and wonderful tradition of another culture. Bravo!

11-chunk_56_-364560583501834212.chunk_text: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4066588/?ref_=tturv_3) Pixar has done it AGAIN! 'Coco' is a yet another delightful ride from the prolific animation studio, who's winning streak seems to never end. And that's good for all, since 'Coco' is all heart & soul, rewarding the moviegoer wholeheartedly.

11-chunk_57_-465705882231431678.chunk_text: And that's good for all, since 'Coco' is all heart & soul, rewarding the moviegoer wholeheartedly. 'Coco' Synopsis: Aspiring musician Miguel, confronted with his family's ancestral ban on music, enters the Land of the Dead to find his great great grandfather, a legendary singer. 'Coco' captures the themes of Life & Death, with genuine feeling. Themes of family, passion, defeat & redemption also are explored here, but with humor & real emotion.

11-chunk_58_-6771333839627845056.chunk_text: Themes of family, passion, defeat & redemption also are explored here, but with humor & real emotion. While I laughed for a good share of this winning story, I also found myself weeping in the film's final act. This is a true fantasy adventure, that gives life & death true meaning. Adrian Molina & Matthew Aldrich's Screenplay is excellent.

11-chunk_59_-5862336084384388613.chunk_text: Adrian Molina & Matthew Aldrich's Screenplay is excellent. Lee Unkrich's Direction is colorful. And of course, the Animation is extraordinary. 'Coco' unfolds gorgeously & not for a second, does the pace drop.

11-chunk_60_-7979132522360893667.chunk_text: 'Coco' unfolds gorgeously & not for a second, does the pace drop. Vocal Performances are top notch! Anthony Gonzalez as Miguel, the protagonist, is a joy, Gael García Bernal s Héctor Rivera, a charming trickster in the Land of the Dead, Benjamin Bratt as Ernesto de la Cruz, the most famous musician in the history of Mexico and Miguel's idol & Ana Ofelia Murguía as Mamá Socorro "Coco" Rivera, Miguel's great grandmother, stand out. And yes, this is a Film made in America about Mexicans & their tradition.

11-chunk_61_-9014588775615762200.chunk_text: And yes, this is a Film made in America about Mexicans & their tradition. Take That, Mr. President! On the whole, 'Coco' deserves all your time & money.

11-chunk_62_-5405173589205336076.chunk_text: On the whole, 'Coco' deserves all your time & money. Don't Miss It. Oscars, are you ready? Helpful

11-chunk_74_5168025135730130779.chunk_text: 10 I cried twice watching this. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw3872461/?ref_=tturv_6) I have always been a fan of Pixar.

11-chunk_75_-3717494968856311932.chunk_text: I have always been a fan of Pixar. They are really good at what they do. These guys set the bar for quality animated movies. Back then, animated movies were pretty much made for kids only.

11-chunk_76_-3150468941752762884.chunk_text: Back then, animated movies were pretty much made for kids only. They were just your usual Sunday morning cartoons. Large eyeballs, goofy voice, exaggerated slapsticks. Disney had its classics like Bambi, Fox and The Hound, Cinderella, Sleeping Beauty.

11-chunk_77_-6400293793407612953.chunk_text: Disney had its classics like Bambi, Fox and The Hound, Cinderella, Sleeping Beauty. However, it felt more like fairy tales. Bedtime stories your parents give as they tuck you in. In this day and age, it wouldn't work that well.

11-chunk_78_3265374316900637822.chunk_text: In this day and age, it wouldn't work that well. Then came Pixar with it's revolutionary debut, Toy Story. Funny, sweet, modern, relatable and plus, completely 3D animated, which marks the first time a feature film was completely 3D animated. And Pixar has been doing just this ever since.

11-chunk_79_916546243108854268.chunk_text: And Pixar has been doing just this ever since. Though the movies they released were still a quality entertainment, I haven't felt like this since Toy Story 3. Toy Story 3 made me bawl like a baby. And their newest feature film, Coco, finally made me weep like a baby again.

11-chunk_80_-2745316000702043734.chunk_text: And their newest feature film, Coco, finally made me weep like a baby again. Coco is a heart warming experience, filled with outstanding animation, wonderful music, brilliant writing, and creative models which brings out the best of Mexican culture. The movie took on themes like family, aspirations, and music. And they merged it marvelously with the Day of the Dead culture in Mexico.

11-chunk_81_-7112081782645004192.chunk_text: And they merged it marvelously with the Day of the Dead culture in Mexico. I also feel that this movie sends a strong message towards those that had lost their loved ones at some point. The way this movie talks about possessions and the inevitable loss that comes will, I hope, comfort you. Coco is a great movie.

11-chunk_82_2495019158878862902.chunk_text: Coco is a great movie. Definitely the best animated movie this year The Emoji Movie? Yeah, don't think so . Could possibly be a nominee for Best Picture this year.

11-chunk_83_-7306333431742154570.chunk_text: Could possibly be a nominee for Best Picture this year. The way it tugs our heartstrings and the emotionally satisfying end will definitely please everyone. And it's definitely up there among Pixar's finest. If Justice League annoys you, just see this movie.

11-chunk_84_-3478155175047925150.chunk_text: If Justice League annoys you, just see this movie. I definitely recommend you. Bring your families, kids to grandparents, whoever you like. I'm sure they'll like it and I'm sure you'll hug 'em all as soon as the credits roll.

11-chunk_85_-3425407224180826179.chunk_text: I'm sure they'll like it and I'm sure you'll hug 'em all as soon as the credits roll. Helpful 535 67

11-chunk_92_7583275292897262652.chunk_text: Surpasses Up and Inside Out https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4130315/?ref_=tturv_8) Coco is about Dias de las Muerte Day of the Dead , family, family crises and musical passion. 11-chunk_94_-203684087437392231.chunk_text: g. "there will be no X in this family! " X being "instead whatever has caused pain to a family member in the past". Pick your poison my reader .

11-chunk_103_-7780033439780019157.chunk_text: Permalink https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4150044/?ref_=tturv_perm_9) 10 The only movie that can make me cry https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw9471266/?ref_=tturv_10) Spoiler

11-chunk_106_6016063886541827267.chunk_text: 10 What's not to like?! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4430985/?ref_=tturv_11) I am very glad I saw "Coco" and understand exactly why it won the Oscar for Best Animated Feature, as it's terrifically entertaining, fun to watch...

11-chunk_107_9022444661454576322.chunk_text: I am very glad I saw "Coco" and understand exactly why it won the Oscar for Best Animated Feature, as it's terrifically entertaining, fun to watch... and quite touching as well. The story is set around Día de Muertos, the Mexican Day of the Dead. Miguel is a nice little boy whose family, inexplicably, HATE music and insist he never can grow up to become a musician.

11-chunk_108_8791407241385480490.chunk_text: Miguel is a nice little boy whose family, inexplicably, HATE music and insist he never can grow up to become a musician. And, wouldn't you know it, but that's EXACTLY what the boy wants to become one day. But after destroying his homemade guitar, he is unable to enter a music contest... so he decides to take one from the local cemetery.

11-chunk_109_-852581509751918638.chunk_text: so he decides to take one from the local cemetery. Not surprisingly, this creates all sorts of problems... and Miguel is transported to the land of the dead. What's next?

11-chunk_110_-2992820713589481811.chunk_text: What's next? Just see the film! The CGI for this film is simply the best you'll currently find... putting it well above the quality of competing studios, such as Universal and Fox.

11-chunk_111_-4479217764859150611.chunk_text: putting it well above the quality of competing studios, such as Universal and Fox. In addition, the scope of the images is just breathtaking.... and a treat to see on the big screen. Additionally, the songs, story and characters are all lovely.

11-chunk_112_-1216313861901989901.chunk_text: Additionally, the songs, story and characters are all lovely. One warning, however, is that this film will very likely start you crying now and again... be sure to have some tissues nearby, just in case. A must see film.

11-chunk_113_4892460517522988413.chunk_text: A must see film. Helpful 88 planktonrules https://www.imdb.com/user/ur2467618/?ref_=tturv_usr_11_t)

11-chunk_115_-4336916107460896759.chunk_text: Arguably The Best Film Of The Year, And Certainly One Of Pixar's Finest. https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw3875424/?ref_=tturv_12) An impeccable fusion of first rate storytelling & jaw dropping animation, Coco is an awe inspiring, highly riveting & endlessly entertaining delight that's crafted with passion, precision & perseverance, and is practically flawless. Arguably the best film of its year, this exquisite ode to remembrance & heartfelt tribute to Mexican culture isn't just Pixar's most culturally defined work to date but is impressive enough to rank amongst the revered studio's finest efforts.

11-chunk_118_-1506676253204719342.chunk_text: 10 A colorful ode to the Mexican culture and to the family values, but that's kinda it https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4073343/?ref_=tturv_13) If you agree with the 'family comes first" motto, but are tired of it being linked solely to the muscular bald guys and fast cars, then Coco will become a pleasant refreshment for you. A lush and lovingly made animation film based on the Dia de los Muertos theme from the Mexican culture, it is a touching experience and a joy to watch.

11-chunk_119_-4882983182053035998.chunk_text: A lush and lovingly made animation film based on the Dia de los Muertos theme from the Mexican culture, it is a touching experience and a joy to watch. However, after all the praise Coco received from all around, the actual viewing experience has left me slightly disappointed. Maybe because I did watch The Book of Life, another animation inspired by the Dia de los Muertos lore and featuring the similar "family wishes vs personal destination" conflict, a film some consider Coco to be a rip off of. Or maybe it's because, despite all its pretty visuals, cute characters and singing solid enough, Coco clearly doesn't invest too much into having more than a single layer of meaning.

11-chunk_120_6556144367925511133.chunk_text: Or maybe it's because, despite all its pretty visuals, cute characters and singing solid enough, Coco clearly doesn't invest too much into having more than a single layer of meaning. You see, here we have a painted prettily and with lots of fizzy buoyant quirks, but still a rather simplistic take on the eternal topic of love's duality and generations' conflict. A kid who loves music, but hatred for it is a family trait for several generations, so he embarks on an unexpected journey through the world of the dead to find a way to unite again what has once been separated and to mend what was once broken. And to sing a few songs and to battle some personal fears while he's at it.

11-chunk_121_1410861665252647.chunk_text: And to sing a few songs and to battle some personal fears while he's at it. There are some nice and emotional scenes along the way, and some lessons learned for some characters, but it's still more or less a linear journey from A to B where good is mostly good although not without a typical feminine touch of a raging maelstrom of emotionality , and bad is, well, at least clearly selfish from the get go, and then it's plain outright evil. What is missing in my opinion is the multi facet delivery, or at least a deeper morals of the story. Sure, "love your relatives and do what you believe in" is cool, but ain't it what every single animated film is eventually about?

11-chunk_122_8207172301087615425.chunk_text: Sure, "love your relatives and do what you believe in" is cool, but ain't it what every single animated film is eventually about? And you could reach the ending inevitable for such genre with some more convoluted and morally difficult effort than just being a boisterous music prodigy with tons of luck to his aid. It's not a good idea to criticize art for not meeting your expectations. After all, nobody does it just for you, so why what you think must matter at all?

11-chunk_123_-5699577800012721112.chunk_text: After all, nobody does it just for you, so why what you think must matter at all? Still, if you are not too fond of stories being rather straightforward, then Coco might feel somewhat shallow. And if you're not a kid who loves everything shiny and moving, then the second half of the film might feel kinda random, slapstick'y and, at times, on seriously heavy drugs the color changing monkey burping blue flames or multiple Frida Kahlos crawling out of a giant papaya to drink an even more giant cactus' tears being some examples . For you, I might recommend watching The Book of Life instead, which, albeit arguably less glossy and vibrant visually, has a story much more complex and not stamping "good" and "evil" labels on things, thus showing the duality of people and of the life itself.

11-chunk_124_5714725078267411524.chunk_text: For you, I might recommend watching The Book of Life instead, which, albeit arguably less glossy and vibrant visually, has a story much more complex and not stamping "good" and "evil" labels on things, thus showing the duality of people and of the life itself. For everyone else, go ahead and watch this film. For its loving care for the Mexican traditions, sharing not just the language but also the passion for something outside the typical Western outlook. And clearly for the multiple Frida Kahlos crawling out of a giant papaya that was hilarious beyond all sane measure!

11-chunk_125_-412261016319267144.chunk_text: And clearly for the multiple Frida Kahlos crawling out of a giant papaya that was hilarious beyond all sane measure! Helpful 76 103

11-chunk_128_390770201679891097.chunk_text: Leaving a review because I'm blown away at the amount of 9's and 10's I'm seeing for this movie, do you all have kids movies on a different scale? 11-chunk_132_4914548201199816407.chunk_text: 10 Overwhelmed! https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw4067024/?ref_=tturv_15) I'm a 24 year old student who sometimes tends to overthink about the values of life and how one, including myself, expresses these kinds of thoughts through every form of art that tells a story.

11-chunk_133_6819370560327434785.chunk_text: I'm a 24 year old student who sometimes tends to overthink about the values of life and how one, including myself, expresses these kinds of thoughts through every form of art that tells a story. So as a person that really puts his soul to a movie he watches I have to say that this film is one of the most beautiful things I've ever had the pleasure of witnessing. Coco does a fantastic job of capturing the viewer from the first moment. It cleverly captures the beauty of the "Day of the Dead" tradition, by unfolding one of the most heartwarming stories I've ever seen in a movie, around it.

11-chunk_134_-6639715182870706075.chunk_text: It cleverly captures the beauty of the "Day of the Dead" tradition, by unfolding one of the most heartwarming stories I've ever seen in a movie, around it. The film features a young Musician called Miguel and the pursuit of his dream of being a musician against his family's approval. Throughout the movie while Miguel engages in an adventurous journey through the land of the dead, he is caught between the love he has for music and the importance of family bonds. Quiet a simple and pretty well covered subject.

11-chunk_135_2877027712817137777.chunk_text: Quiet a simple and pretty well covered subject. Somehow, Coco manages to so simply and beatifully capture the essence of what it means to be human. What it means to love and what it means to have passion for the things and the people you love. The story was told in such an elegant way that it didn't make me think about the values it represented, but instead it made me feel them, without me even analysing what I was watching.

11-chunk_136_3225730607419584118.chunk_text: The story was told in such an elegant way that it didn't make me think about the values it represented, but instead it made me feel them, without me even analysing what I was watching. It did it so gradually that at some point near the end I was so overwhelmed by a scene, which definetely goes to my "top 10 best movie scenes" list, that I caught myself crying. Not tearing up like I usually do when a scene touches me. Actually crying.

11-chunk_137_7503159312639986139.chunk_text: Actually crying. I could go on and on about Coco, but I'll leave with saying that this is a fantastic movie and I honestly feel grateful that I had the chance to watch it. A must see!!! Helpful

11-chunk_141_15805074220272010.chunk_text: As a Mexican born child I cried when I saw this movie and my son who is American born with Mexican parents loves it too.. love to teach him about our roots Helpful 136

11-chunk_148_-7539746835932505041.chunk_text: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw7595956/?ref_=tturv_18) "Coco" is the best animated film from Pixar and the best animated film of the present time. The animation is impressive capturing the magic of Mexico and día de muertos, with colorful cinematography and tremendous characters.

11-chunk_149_-8464034850893326325.chunk_text: The animation is impressive capturing the magic of Mexico and día de muertos, with colorful cinematography and tremendous characters. The voice work of the Mexican and Mexican American actors is impressive, each voice full of emotions and with a great talent for singing that excels in each musical theme. "Coco" is the best film based on a Latin American country, a masterpiece! Helpful

11-chunk_152_8919164941577223371.chunk_text: 10 Absolutely lovely https://www.imdb.com/title/tt2380307/review/rw5099000/?ref_=tturv_19) Everything about this movie is wonderful. The characters, the meaning, the songs, the cinematography, the storyline.

11-chunk_153_8270208156667871778.chunk_text: The characters, the meaning, the songs, the cinematography, the storyline. An absolutely lovely movie. Even as an adult, or perhaps because, I cried at the ending. Such love and such joy.
